text:
The arrondissement of Florac is an arrondissement of France; it is part of the Lozère "département" in the Occitanie region.
History.
When the Lozère department was created on 17 February 1800, the "arrondissement" of Florac was part of that original department.
Geography.
It is the smallest and southernmost of the two "arrondissements" of the department, with an area of. It has 13,313 inhabitants and a density of inhabitants/km²
The "arrondissement" is bordered to the north by the "arrondissement" of Mende, to the east and south by the Gard department, and to the west by the Aveyron department.
Cantons.
After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the "arrondissements" so they could have "communes" that belong to different "arrondissements".
Communes.
There is only a town with more than 1,000 inhabitants, and it is the subprefecture, Florac Trois Rivières, with 2,107 inhabitants.
